node.title: House January 6 committee aiming to publish interim report this June, panel's chair says
node.description: The panel's timeline could be pushed back if investigators learn new information or seek additional testimony.

node.title: At least 8 additional babies sickened by recalled formula, lawyer says
node.description: The plant that made all four brands of recalled formula has a history of FDA-documented safety problems.

node.title: Decision today on DHBs' injunction against hospital workers' strike
node.description: The Employment Court is meeting under urgency this morning to consider an injunction to stop a planned strike by Allied Health workers at public hospitals tomorrow. Audio

node.title: 'It does definitely feel like it's everywhere': Covid-19 hits start of university year
node.description: University students living in halls of residence say almost everyone they know has Covid-19 as first semester kicks off for 2022. Audio

node.title: Govt taking public feedback on managing new forest planting

node.title: Local chapter of a global climate governance initiative launched
node.description: Directors are getting some additional help to navigate climate change risks and opportunities, which are expected to have influence well beyond the boardroom table.

node.title: Changes needed so the cash system can serve the needs of NZers - Reserve Bank
node.description: The central bank's 2021 cash survey found nearly two-thirds of New Zealanders were using cash to pay for everyday things, compared with nearly everyone in 2017 and 2019.

node.title: Surgery centre cuts services, diverts staff to Middlemore amid Omicron woes
node.description: One half of a large elective surgery centre has been temporarily closed so staff can be diverted help Middlemore Hospital.

node.title: Free rapid antigen tests available for home Covid-19 testing
node.description: Free rapid antigen tests are now available for home testing if you are symptomatic or household contact but you will have to order them online and pick them up.

node.title: Torrential rain to continue in Sydney after night of evacuations
node.description: Multiple warnings remain in place for Sydney after hundreds of people were ordered to flee their homes overnight as the city's rivers were swelled by a deluge of rain soaking the state.

node.title: Amazon closing its brick-and-mortar bookstores

node.title: Top Trump official ousted over Bolton book to return to NSC

node.title: Hotels planning full room refits as managed isolation and quarantine comes to an end

node.title: Russian paratroopers land in Ukraine's second largest city

node.title: Serena Williams speaks out after NYT mistakenly uses a photo of her sister

node.title: 'Putin was wrong, we were ready,' Biden's State of the Union address

node.title: House price growth rate lowest since Sept 2020

node.title: New South Wales flooding death toll rises
node.description: The New South Wales flooding death toll has risen as the state braces for further flooding, while tens of thousands of residents in Queensland are still without power with more storms forecast.
